intro: Dysoxylum excelsum var. pedicellatum, commonly known as the broad-leafed dysoxylum, is a tropical tree native to regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Bombacaceae and is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers. The plant produces woody capsules that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. It thrives in humid, lowland environments and is often found in secondary forests and along riverbanks. Its botanical features make it an important species for both ecological and ornamental purposes.
